title: 379-G
statement: G. New Year Cactustime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutJack and Jill are tired of the New Year tree, now they've got a New Year cactus at home! A cactus is a connected undirected graph where any two simple cycles have at most one common vertex. In other words, this graph doesn't have any edges that lie on more than one simple cycle.On the 31st of December they are going to decorate the cactus by hanging toys to its vertices. At most one toy is going to hang on each vertex — it's either the toy Jack hung or the toy Jill hung. It's possible for a vertex to have no toys.Jack and Jill has been arguing, so they don't want any edge to connect two vertices where one vertex has Jack's toy and the other vertex has Jill's toy.Jack has decided to hangatoys. What maximum number of toysbcan Jill hang if they both cooperate to maximize this value? Your task is to write a program that finds the soughtbfor allafrom 0 to the number of vertices on the New Year Cactus.InputThe first line contains two integersnandm(1 ≤n≤ 2500,n- 1 ≤m) — the number of vertices and the number of edges, correspondingly. The nextmlines contain two integersa,beach (1 ≤a,b≤n,a≠b) that mean that there is an edge connecting verticesaиb. Any pair of vertices has at most one edge between them.OutputThe first line must contain space-separatedba(for all0 ≤a≤n) wherebaequals the maximum number of Jill's toys on the cactus considering that it hasaJack's toys. Numbersbago in the order of increasinga.ExamplesInput1 0Output1 0Input16 201 23 45 66 77 89 1010 1111 1213 1415 161 59 1314 1010 66 215 1111 77 316 128 4Output16 13 12 12 10 8 8 7 6 4 4 3 3 1 0 0 0NoteThe cactus from the second example is:

processed.result:
You are given a cactus, which is a special type of tree where every cycle has at most one shared vertex.  

You need to find the maximum number of toys Jill can hang on the cactus for each number of toys Jack hangs, from 0 to the total number of vertices.  

Here are the rules:

* Each vertex can have at most one toy.
* Jack and Jill's toys cannot be on the same edge.


The input will be:

* The number of vertices ($n$)
* The number of edges ($m$)
* $m$ lines, each containing two integers representing an edge between two vertices.

The output will be:

* A list of numbers, where each number represents the maximum number of Jill's toys for a given number of Jack's toys (from 0 to $n$).

You are given a tree-like structure with nodes connected by edges.  You need to determine the maximum number of items that can be placed on the nodes, given that:

*  Each node can have at most one item.
*  No two nodes connected by an edge can have items of opposite types. 


You are given the number of nodes and edges, and a list of edges.  You need to find the maximum number of items of one type that can be placed on the nodes for each possible number of items of the other type.
